content.description: Gwyneth measured the weights, in pounds, of ten striped bass taken from a local river. She calculated a mean weight of <math alttext="13" overflow="scroll"><mn>13</mn></math> pounds and a range of <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> pounds. For a report, Gwyneth converted the measurements from pounds to kilograms. (Note: There is approximately <math alttext="0.454" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.454</mn></math> kilogram in <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> pound.)
content.question: Which of the following is closest to the mean and range of the converted weights?

choices.label: The mean weight is <math alttext="28.63" overflow="scroll"><mn>28.63</mn></math> kilograms, and the range is <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> kilograms.
The mean weight is <math alttext="28.63" overflow="scroll"><mn>28.63</mn></math> kilograms, and the range is <math alttext="2.27" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.27</mn></math> kilograms.
The mean weight is <math alttext="5.90" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.90</mn></math> kilograms, and the range is <math alttext="11.01" overflow="scroll"><mn>11.01</mn></math> kilograms.
The mean weight is <math alttext="5.90" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.90</mn></math> kilograms, and the range is <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> kilograms.
The mean weight is <math alttext="5.90" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.90</mn></math> kilograms, and the range is <math alttext="2.27" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.27</mn></math> kilograms.

content.answer: The mean weight is <math alttext="5.90" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.90</mn></math> kilograms, and the range is <math alttext="2.27" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.27</mn></math> kilograms.

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
